description.content: Register a new user account and receive JWT access and refresh tokens
Authenticate user and receive JWT access and refresh tokens
Exchange refresh token for new access and refresh tokens (token rotation)
Revoke refresh token and end user session
Revoke all refresh tokens for the authenticated user
Update authenticated user's profile information
View active tokens for authenticated user (development only)
Get authenticated user's information

item.name: Search for user profiles using GraphRAG

request.name: Search for user profiles using GraphRAG

description.content:
Performs semantic search across user profiles using pgvector-based GraphRAG.
Searches through profile chunks and knowledge graph to find relevant candidates based on
natural language queries. Automatically excludes the requesting user from results and
respects tenant boundaries for data isolation.

response.name: Search results with user profiles and metadata

description.content:
Returns the health status of the pgvector GraphRAG service.
Used for monitoring and ensuring service availability.

Returns operational statistics for the pgvector GraphRAG service including
total chunks indexed, edge count, and average response time metrics.
Useful for monitoring service performance and data volume.
Returns comprehensive health status including uptime, version, and system checks
Checks if application is ready to serve requests (database connectivity, etc.)
Basic liveness check - returns 200 if server is alive
Returns v2 API health status with available features and endpoints

Creates or updates permission policies for a specific node. Requires authentication and node ownership. Supports setting multiple policies in a single request. Policies without a nodeId will inherit the nodeId from the URL parameter.
(Required) UUID of the node to set permissions for

item.name: Get all permission policies for a node

request.name: Get all permission policies for a node

description.content: Retrieves all permission policies associated with a specific node. Only accessible by the node owner. Returns an array of policies with subject information and permission levels.
(Required) UUID of the node to get permissions for

response.name: Success response with array of policies

description.content: Permanently removes a permission policy from a node. Requires authentication and node ownership. The policy and all its associated permissions will be deleted.
(Required) UUID of the node (used for route matching)
(Required) UUID of the policy to delete
Updates an existing permission policy. Allows modification of permission level, expiration date, and other policy attributes. Requires authentication and node ownership.
(Required) UUID of the policy to update

item.name: Update multiple permission policies in bulk

request.name: Update multiple permission policies in bulk

description.content: Updates multiple permission policies in a single request. All updates are processed in parallel. Requires authentication and ownership of all affected nodes. Maximum 100 policy updates per request.

response.name: All policies successfully updated with count
Validation error (invalid data, min 1 max 100 updates)
Access denied (not owner of one or more nodes)
One or more policies not found

item.name: Get permissions for multiple nodes in bulk

request.name: Get permissions for multiple nodes in bulk

description.content: Retrieves permission policies for multiple nodes in a single request. Each node's policies are enriched with user information for user-type subjects. Requires authentication and ownership of all requested nodes. Failed individual node retrievals return empty policy arrays.

response.name: Success response with permissions grouped by nodeId
Validation error (invalid node IDs, minimum 1 required)

item.name: Update user's career interest during onboarding

request.name: Update user's career interest during onboarding

description.content: Updates the authenticated user's career interest field during the onboarding process. This endpoint validates the interest data and persists it to the user's profile.
Marks the authenticated user's onboarding process as complete and updates their user status. This endpoint should be called after all onboarding steps have been completed.

header.value: user not found or already completed
user not found or already completed

item.name: Extract profile data from multiple sources

request.name: Extract profile data from multiple sources

description.content: Extracts comprehensive profile data (experiences, education) from multiple sources using the provided username. If the user has already completed onboarding, returns their existing profile data. This endpoint aggregates data from various platforms to create a unified profile.

response.name: Invalid username or failed to extract profile data

item.name: Save filtered profile data as hierarchy nodes

request.name: Save filtered profile data as hierarchy nodes

description.content: Saves the user's filtered profile data by creating hierarchy nodes for their experiences, education, and projects. This endpoint validates that the user hasn't already completed onboarding (to prevent duplicates), transforms the profile data into hierarchy nodes, and marks the onboarding as complete. Each experience becomes a job node with optional project children, and each education entry becomes an education node.
Retrieves all organizations that the authenticated user is a member of

item.name: Create a new update for a career transition node

request.name: Create a new update for a career transition node

description.content: Creates a new update entry for a career transition node. Updates track weekly progress including job applications, networking activities, skill development, and interview outcomes. Requires user authentication and permission to edit the node.
(Required) UUID of the career transition node

response.name: Created update with generated ID and timestamps
User lacks permission to create updates for this node

item.name: Get paginated list of updates for a career transition node

request.name: Get paginated list of updates for a career transition node

description.content: Retrieves all updates for a specific career transition node with pagination support. Returns updates in reverse chronological order (newest first). Requires user authentication and permission to view the node.
Page number (default: 1, min: 1)
Items per page (default: 20, min: 1, max: 100)
(Required) UUID of the career transition node

response.name: Paginated list of updates with metadata

item.name: Get a specific update by ID

request.name: Get a specific update by ID

description.content: Retrieves a single update by its ID. Validates that the update belongs to the specified node. Requires user authentication and permission to view the node.
(Required) UUID of the career transition node
(Required) UUID of the update

response.name: Update details including notes, activity flags, and timestamps
User lacks permission to view this update

(Required) UUID of the career transition node
(Required) UUID of the update to modify

response.name: Updated update with modified fields and updated timestamp
User lacks permission to edit this update

description.content: Permanently deletes an update from a career transition node. This action cannot be undone. Requires user authentication and permission to edit the node.
(Required) UUID of the career transition node
(Required) UUID of the update to delete

response.name: User lacks permission to delete this update
